Malaysian party officials visit DPRK embassy
articles.content:
Malaysian party officials visit DPRK embassy 
    Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- Tan Sri Mohamad Mohd Taim, vice-president of the united Malays national organization of Malaysia, and other leadership members visited the DPRK embassy in Kuala Lumpur on April 15 on the occasion of the 90th birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.
 After seeing a film showing the revolutionary history of Kim Il Sung, they looked round a photograph "a whole life devoted to the people" on display, expressing boundless reverence for him.

articles.title: Japan condemned for approving distorted history textbook
articles.content:
Japan condemned for approving distorted history textbook 
    Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- Over 300 members of the fellowship society of Tok Islet and 16 other organizations in South Korea held a rally in Seoul on April 14 denouncing the Japanese government for having passed at an examination history textbook asserting that Tok Islet belongs to Japan, Seoul-based radio no. 1 said.
 The ralliers condemned such passage as one more historic act of aggression.    
 After the rally they made a protest march up to the Japanese embassy.

articles.title: Anti-war, anti-U.S. struggle called for
articles.content:
Anti-war, anti-U.S. struggle called for 
    Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- The central standing committee of the Seoul District Federation of University Student Councils reportedly issued an appeal on April 15 with the inauguration of the tenth-term South Korean Federation of University Student Councils (Hanchongryon) just at hand.
 Saying it was decided to set the period from April 19 to May 18 as "an anti-U.S., anti-war month for peace to implement the June 15 joint declaration" and wage a joint struggle to shatter the U.S. moves to invade the north, the appeal called for waging a vigorous anti-U.S. and anti-war struggle wherever youth and students are.    
 It also called for making the inaugural ceremony of the tenth-term Hanchongryon an occasion of dealing a telling blow to Bush, Ri Hoe Chang and other anti-reunification war hawks who are trying to ditch the June 15 joint declaration, perpetuate the division of the Korean nation and ignite a war in this land at any cost and of making a breakthrough in the movement for the independent reunification.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's works published in Italy
Letter to Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Letter to Kim Jong Il 
    Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il Saturday received a letter from the representatives of friendship and solidarity organizations of various countries and international organizations who were leaving here after visiting the DPRK to commemorate the 90th birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.
 The letter said that what deeply moved them staying in Korea is that Kim Il Sung is still alive in the hearts of the Korean people and the DPRK works hard to build a powerful nation and reunify the country, full of conviction, under the uplifted banner of socialism, as it did in his lifetime.    
 As guided by Kim Jong Il, the great Korean people will brave any threat and pressure of the imperialist forces and successfully turn their country into a reunified powerful country in which everything goes well in the near future, the letter stressed.

Plan to introduce U.S. fighters protested in S. Korea
articles.content:
Plan to introduce U.S. fighters protested in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- Representatives of South Korean public organizations including the catholic priests' council for justice, the council for national reconciliation and independent reunification, the international solidarity for democracy and a society of people working for peace and reunification reportedly paid the second protest visit to Chongwadae on April 19 in demand of the withdrawal of the plan to introduce "F-15K" fighters.
 They stated that the introduction of "F-15K" fighters which are unfavourable in price, operation and maintenance expenses, performance, transfer of technology, supply of parts and all other aspects would bring great misfortunes to the people. They said that it was reported that the hardcore members in power were bribed to select fighters of the next generation and suspicion is growing. They called for making a probe into the truth behind the suspicion, making it public and a stop to selecting "F-15" fighters and pushing forward the introduction of fighters of the next generation.
